Dear Pleasantville Families,

As we continue to get closer to the start of the 2020-2021 school year we know it is important to reach out to gather information and listen to feedback from our Trojan Families.

With that in mind, we ask each Pleasantville family with school-aged children to consider filling out this short survey that will help inform and guide our “return to learn” planning and focus areas over the next few weeks. Pleasantville Schools has been and will continue to closely monitor the status of the COVID-19 virus. The school has been and will continue working with state and local public health partners and experts on preventative and response measures.

Although our level of concern is heightened, as of March 4, 2020 there are currently no positive cases of COVID-19 in Iowa. https://idph.iowa.gov/Emerging-Health-Issues/Novel-Coronavirus

The prevention measures and best practices for COVID-19 are the exact same protocols as prevention of influenza, which includes:

* Washing hands frequently with soap and water
* Covering coughs and sneezes with a tissue or your upper arm/elbow
* Contain germs by staying home when a person is ill

Additionally, Pleasantville Schools are promoting proper hand washing and cleaning and disinfecting high touch surfaces daily.

Internal applicants may direct their email letter of interest to Linda Russell.
